alert.note: Alert for Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 12:05PM EST until March 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, and Golconda. .River levels along the lower Ohio River are falling currently but many points are expected to have rises again late this week due to recent rainfall in the basin. Many points will remain in flood for this week and beyond. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY, MARCH 18... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 18. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 42.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 41.2 feet Wednesday morning, then rise to a secondary crest of 42.0 feet Saturday afternoon. Afterwards, it will fall below flood stage Thursday, March 17. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
